page.title: 07AYLESTONE MEADOWS (part 2)
page.content: The use of the Aylestone Meadows as a recreational area has also incorporated the old transportation links. {****** THE GRAND UNION CANAL ****** This was built in 1793 for carrying coal, gunpowder, bricks etc. and inter-links with the RIVER SOAR. Nowadays it is used by{leisure}and {holiday craft}and for{fishing.}The newly improved tow paths are used by {athletes}for training and{jogging purposes and by families who consider the canal side a pleasant{walk. {***** THE GREAT CENTRAL RAILWAY ***** This was built between 1893 and 1899 as a route from London to Sheffield. It was closed in the 1960's and the rails and sleepers removed. It is now a{walk way}and{nature trail} used by families and again by{athletes for training and jogging.
